billEvents.eventText: referred to corporations, authorities and commissions

title: Sets the fee to fifty for filing and recording articles of incorporation for churches
summary: Sets the fee to fifty dollars for filing and recording articles of incorporation for churches.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2224

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 14, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. GIBSON -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Corporations, Authorities and Commissions

       AN ACT to amend the religious corporations law and the executive law, in
         relation  to  setting  the  fee to 50 dollars for filing and recording
         articles of incorporation for churches

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The religious corporations law is amended by adding a new
    2  section 3-a to read as follows:
    3    S 3-A. FEE FOR FILING AND RECORDING. ALL COUNTIES SHALL CHARGE  A  FEE
    4  OF FIFTY DOLLARS FOR FILING AND RECORDING A CERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION
    5  FOR A RELIGIOUS CORPORATION.
    6    S  2.  Subdivision  9 of section 96 of the executive law is amended by
    7  adding a new paragraph (c) to read as follows:
    8    (C) FOR FILING UNDER THE RELIGIOUS CORPORATIONS LAW: A CERTIFICATE  OF
    9  INCORPORATION, FIFTY DOLLARS.
   10    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06277-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the religious corporations law and the executive law, in relation to setting the fee to 50 dollars for filing and recording articles of incorporation for churches
